m.0162sr_4.Query Analysis: The query asks about the location where Navajo Indians live.

m.0162sr_4.Document Content Analysis: The document provides detailed information about the Navajo Nation, including its size, location, governance structure, and historical context. It mentions that the Navajo Nation spans parts of northeastern Arizona, southeastern Utah, and northwestern New Mexico, covering an area of approximately 27,425 square miles (45,000 km² to 71,000 km² depending on the source). The document also highlights that it is home to nearly 75,000 Navajo Indians.
